com.codecool.jopburndown.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.jopburndown.model.Board

  • @Entity
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of a Board represents one playing board of a minesweeper game. Upon instantiating, it creates an actual board and a copy of that board. By calling the sout method on a board instance, its toString method will print out the whole playing board in a formatted form.

      • Board

        public Board(int size)
        The constructor creates an actual board. This is done by the createBoard method.
        Parameters:
        size - size for new board
        See Also:
        createBoard(int) Then it calls the replacer method. To see how this works, replacer() It also creates a copy of that field, which will be used in the search engine., searchEngine(int, int)

      • getListToReveal

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getListToReveal(int x,
                                                                         int y)
        This is the function which will be called from outside the Board class in order to return all coordinates where there is a zero or a field next to a zero.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the center of the examination
        y - the y coordinate of the center of the examination
        Returns:
        all the coordinates where there is a zero or a number next to a zero.

      • getAllCharsToDisplay

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Character> getAllCharsToDisplay(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> coords)
        This method will get ceratin coordinates, it checks what numbers are present at these locations and will return a list of these elements.
        Parameters:
        coords - A list of coordinates
        Returns:
        A list of characters, which are present at the given coordinates.
